org.apache.ignite.ml.trees.trainers.columnbased.vectors

Interface FeatureProcessor<D extends RegionInfo,S extends SplitInfo<D>>

  • Type Parameters:
    D - Class representing data of regions resulted from split.
    S - Class representing data of split.
    All Known Implementing Classes:
    CategoricalFeatureProcessor, ContinuousFeatureProcessor

    public interface FeatureProcessor<D extends RegionInfo,S extends SplitInfo<D>>
    Base interface for feature processors used in ColumnDecisionTreeTrainer

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      com.zaxxer.sparsebits.SparseBitSet calculateOwnershipBitSet(RegionProjection<D> regionPrj, double[] values, S s)
      Calculates the bitset mapping each data point to left (corresponding bit is set) or right subregion.
      RegionProjection<D> createInitialRegion(Integer[] samples, double[] values, double[] labels)
      Creates initial region from samples.
      SplitInfo findBestSplit(RegionProjection<D> regionPrj, double[] values, double[] labels, int regIdx)
      Finds best split by this feature among all splits of all regions.
      IgniteBiTuple<RegionProjection,RegionProjection> performSplit(com.zaxxer.sparsebits.SparseBitSet bs, RegionProjection<D> reg, D leftData, D rightData)
      Splits given region using bitset which maps data point to left or right subregion.
      IgniteBiTuple<RegionProjection,RegionProjection> performSplitGeneric(com.zaxxer.sparsebits.SparseBitSet bs, double[] values, RegionProjection<D> reg, RegionInfo leftData, RegionInfo rightData)
      Splits given region using bitset which maps data point to left or right subregion.

    • Method Detail

      • findBestSplit

        SplitInfo findBestSplit(RegionProjection<D> regionPrj,
                        double[] values,
                        double[] labels,
                        int regIdx)
        Finds best split by this feature among all splits of all regions.
        Returns:
        best split by this feature among all splits of all regions.

      • createInitialRegion

        RegionProjection<D> createInitialRegion(Integer[] samples,
                                        double[] values,
                                        double[] labels)
        Creates initial region from samples.
        Parameters:

        Returns:

      • calculateOwnershipBitSet

        com.zaxxer.sparsebits.SparseBitSet calculateOwnershipBitSet(RegionProjection<D> regionPrj,
                                                            double[] values,
                                                            S s)
        Calculates the bitset mapping each data point to left (corresponding bit is set) or right subregion.
        Parameters:
        s - data used for calculating the split.
        Returns:
        Bitset mapping each data point to left (corresponding bit is set) or right subregion.

      • performSplit

        IgniteBiTuple<RegionProjection,RegionProjection> performSplit(com.zaxxer.sparsebits.SparseBitSet bs,
                                                              RegionProjection<D> reg,
                                                              D leftData,
                                                              D rightData)
        Splits given region using bitset which maps data point to left or right subregion. This method is present for the vectors of the same type to be able to pass between them information about regions and therefore used iff the optimal split is received on feature of the same type.
        Parameters:
        bs - Bitset which maps data point to left or right subregion.
        leftData - Data of the left subregion.
        rightData - Data of the right subregion.
        Returns:
        This feature vector.

      • performSplitGeneric

        IgniteBiTuple<RegionProjection,RegionProjection> performSplitGeneric(com.zaxxer.sparsebits.SparseBitSet bs,
                                                                     double[] values,
                                                                     RegionProjection<D> reg,
                                                                     RegionInfo leftData,
                                                                     RegionInfo rightData)
        Splits given region using bitset which maps data point to left or right subregion. This method is used iff the optimal split is received on feature of different type, therefore information about regions is limited to the RegionInfo class which is base for all classes used to represent region data.
        Parameters:
        bs - Bitset which maps data point to left or right subregion.
        leftData - Data of the left subregion.
        rightData - Data of the right subregion.
        Returns:
        This feature vector.
